snippet: Nearly all the major insurers have agreed to cover their customers retroactively if they go to the emergency room or doctor’s office after Jan. 1, but send in their payment by Jan. 10.
abstract: Nearly all major insurance companies, worried about potential chaos in January 2014 as people begin seeking coverage under the federal health care law without completing necessary paperwork, agree to give consumers an extra 10 days to pay their first-month premiums.
lead_paragraph: Nearly all the major insurers have agreed to cover their customers retroactively if they go to the emergency room or doctor’s office after Jan. 1, but send in their payment by Jan. 10.

headline.main: Health Insurers Extend Deadline for First Premiums

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
